turn.1: what is the connection between ClientEarth and access to water?
turn.2: In 2010, ClientEarth filed a lawsuit against the Council of the European Union, regarding plans to revise the EU's 2002 access-to-documents law, which gives individuals the right to view internal EU documents.
turn.4: ClientEarth sued the Council over its alleged failure to disclose its in-house legal opinion about the review of the 2002 rules.
turn.5: who does the organization work with?
turn.6: Employees of ClientEarth include Professor Ludwig Krämer and CEO James Thornton; the latter was named by the New Statesman in 2009 as one of "ten people who could change the world".
turn.8: Coldplay are patrons of the organisation.
turn.9: what other famous people are associated?
turn.10: Brian Eno is one of the group's trustees.
turn.12: In June 2019, Pink Floyd band member David Gilmour pledged to donate 21.5 M USD, raised from the sale of his guitar collection.
